answers.answer: This is a patient to patient forum on diabetes. I would suggest you post on the Ask a Doctor Forum - Gastroenterology. It would help if told the forum doctor what test has been performed and whether your husband has been screened for cancer.

question: my husband recently had his left foot ambutated halfway after difficulty in healing of the 4th toe.he has been diabetic for 15 years with a smoking and drinking habit which he not done for 3 months. his problems got worse when he came home after surgery.he was vomiting and having runny stool for 3 days, got him to er and was admitted for the 2nd round with same symptoms.it took the hospital 5 days to get the vomiting under control the 1st time. at the same time the let him come home with c-dif,and no diagnosis for his symptoms.1 week late he is back to hospital with same symptoms,he is npo that stops the diahrea but the vomiting persists.his sugar levels are above 250 even 4 days after admission with nothing to eat but nacl iv and some antibiotics. still no diagnosis so they have no idea what to treat him for. gets reglan which is not helping.he has high blood  pressure, congestive heart failure, had mild heart attack,poor vision, difficulty urinating,servere nausea,poor ambulatory balance,slightly damaged kidneys.what is the cause fo his nausea and uncontrollable vomiting and diahrea? please help.
title: vomiting and diabetes
